solution_line_template: There is {uphill_miles} miles uphill because {total_trail_length} x {uphill_percent_decimal} = <<{total_trail_length}*{uphill_percent_decimal}={uphill_miles}>>{uphill_miles}
This takes him {uphill_minutes} minutes because {uphill_hours} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{uphill_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={uphill_minutes}>>{uphill_minutes}
{downhill_percent}% of the trail is downhill because {total_percent} - {uphill_percent} = <<{total_percent}-{uphill_percent}={downhill_percent}>>{downhill_percent}
There are {downhill_miles} miles of downhill because {total_trail_length} x {downhill_percent_decimal} = <<{total_trail_length}*{downhill_percent_decimal}={downhill_miles}>>{downhill_miles}
This takes him {downhill_hours} of an hour because {downhill_miles} / {downhill_speed} = ({downhill_hours})
This takes him {downhill_minutes} minutes because {minutes_per_hour} x ({downhill_hours}) = <<{minutes_per_hour}*({downhill_hours})={downhill_minutes}>>{downhill_minutes}
It takes him {total_minutes} minutes in total because {uphill_minutes} + {downhill_minutes} = <<{uphill_minutes}+{downhill_minutes}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes}
